meanings.definition: To set or adjust in advance
meanings.sent1: Before the party, she was presetting the table with colorful decorations.
meanings.sent2: He always likes to preset the alarm clock before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept presetting the same task over and over, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a computer, presetting each step of the plan with precision.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush seemed to be presetting the colors on the canvas effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of setting or adjusting in advance
meanings.sent1: The presetting of the thermostat helped keep the room at a comfortable temperature.
meanings.sent2: His job involved the presetting of the machinery before each production run.
meanings.sent3: The presetting of the stage for the play was done with great care and attention to detail.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the presetting of the day's schedule was like a well-organized puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The presetting of the timer on the camera ensured the perfect shot every time.
